results.title: Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
About Mangomint

Mangomint is a fast-growing Series A stage SaaS company on a mission to provide next-generation software that embeds so seamlessly into the day-to-day activities of salons and spas, that it effectively disappears. Our platform is used (and loved!) daily by more than 10,000 salon and spa professionals in the U.S. and Canada to handle everything from appointment booking, staff management, payment processing, and so much more.

Backed by one of the leading product-led growth VCs, you can be sure the opportunity to work at Mangomint is filled with possibilities.

We‚Äôre still a pretty small team but we‚Äôre doing really BIG things. We‚Äôre a fully remote, fun and hard-working team with the occasional in-person meetup every few months. Come build with us!


About the Role

Our ideal Product Marketing Manager is a growth-minded, customer journey obsessed self-starter who has deep experience collaborating with product, marketing, sales and customer success teams to develop GTM strategy, perfect product positioning and drive customer acquisition, adoption and expansion.

As our first dedicated product marketing hire, this role will lead the charge in driving core product marketing functions ‚Äî think product launches, value-based messaging, market and competitor research, ICP and persona development, sales enablement, etc. ‚Äî and also work closely with product and engineering to identify, test and implement in-product growth levers.

This role sits at the intersection of product, product marketing and growth in a strong PLG-focused organization and is the perfect opportunity for a nimble and analytical rising growth leader.

What you‚Äôll be doing

  • Own core product marketing functions including product launches, value-based messaging, market and competitor research, ICP and persona development, sales enablement, etc.
  • Lead the growth charge; strategize and execute on growth experiments and in-product loops that drive signups, usage, and retention
  • Measure the effectiveness of product marketing and growth efforts; connect impact to key business metrics
  • Analyze data to pinpoint high impact opportunities and manage prioritization of future experiments and initiatives
  • Build messaging and positioning for Mangomint products that clearly communicates our competitive advantage in the market
  • Intimately understand our market, customers and competitive landscape; you are the voice of the customer
  • Optimize the full customer journey to maximize user experience and adoption (especially the free trial process)
  • Work collaboratively with product, marketing, sales, customer success and other internal teams
  • Influence strategy for and manage growth-oriented product roadmap initiatives
  • Help build cross-functional product management and product marketing processes at scale

Requirements

  • 2+ years of hands-on product marketing and/or growth marketing experience in B2B SaaS
  • Deep knowledge of product-led growth strategy and tactics; ability to look at all opportunities, experiments and initiatives through a PLG lens
  • Data obsessed with analytical mindset; organized in planning, executing and tracking performance
  • Strong testing mentality and ability to be analytical in everything you do
  • Extensive experience with product marketing functions like product launches, enablement, market research, ICP development, etc.
  • Exceptional ability to write product messaging that communicates value and connects to the market‚Äôs needs
  • Deep customer empathy and ability to impact experience across full customer journey
  • Proficiency with marketing and analytics tools (Segment, Mixpanel, Intercom, marketing automation, in-app messaging, CRM, etc.)
  • Strong project management skills, including ability prioritize high impact activities and move complex project forward efficiently and effectively
  • Extensive knowledge of SaaS product management processes; has the technical chops to collaborate with engineers
  • Curious, continuous learner who thrives in startup environment

Benefits

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Generous monthly wellness budget for gym memberships, yoga, spas, etc.
  • Premium subscription to the Calm app
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Lots of opportunities for career and personal growth
  • Remote work
  • Competitive compensation
  • Supportive environment with fun and respectful culture
  • 401k (no matching‚Ä¶yet)



Mangomint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disability and genetic information (including family medical history).

results.title: Demand Generation Lead
results.description:
About the Opportunity
Settle is on a mission to change the way that businesses pay other businesses. Since the company‚Äôs inception in 2019, we‚Äôve been building a cashflow management platform that allows founders and small business owners to more easily manage their company‚Äôs financial health with a mix of accounts payable and flexible financing tools. We already work with some amazing brands that you probably know and love, like Starface, Ghia, and Italic.

We‚Äôre growing quickly and looking to expand our small-but-mighty marketing team from two to three. This role will offer an exciting hands-on opportunity for a builder to lay the foundation for, and fuel our growth with digital campaigns of all types, from email to PPC and more. You‚Äôll help deploy cross-channel campaigns in conjunction with our sales team to maximize lead generation, upsells, and ultimately conversions. As the third member of the marketing team, you‚Äôll have a unique chance to drive the long-term direction of the org and plenty of opportunity for personal career growth as well.

How You‚Äôll Make an Impact
- Strategize, conceptualize, and execute campaigns across digital channels
- Develop marketing hypotheses and test assumptions with quantitative analysis
- Drive measurable impact to the business through growing pipeline
- Collaborate with Product Marketing and Customer Success to automate and optimize marketing flows
- Partner closely with Sales to develop alignment needed to set the business up to hit growth targets
- Optimize targeted campaigns to drive results within distinct customer segments
- Source and manage external contractors and agencies to augment marketing efforts when needed
- Source, optimize, and implement appropriate marketing tools to deliver positive ROI to the business

What Sets You Apart
- 5+ years experience in a B2B marketing role
- Previous experience working closely with a sales org to define handoff criteria and set them up for success converting leads
- Previous experience building and executing email marketing (and drip) campaigns
- Broad experience with top of funnel ‚Äî¬†you‚Äôre comfortable with a variety of digital mediums, from email to SEO to paid search/social and beyond. You don‚Äôt need to be an expert in everything but you will have at least dabbled across channels
- Experience building and running paid digital ads on platforms like Google and LinkedIn.
- Fluent in Google Analytics (or other analytics platforms) and marketing attribution
- Prior experience with building out at least one marketing system in a previous role, and opinions about tooling/marketing stack
- Desire and ability to take calculated risks
- Strong written and verbal communication skills
- Great at identifying gaps and asking questions to find a solution (rather than waiting for a solution to fall into your lap)
Bonuses:
- A personal interest in DTC/CPG/Ecomm industry or fintech, or both
- Experience managing social media accounts for a brand/business
- Experience building budgets for omnichannel campaigns
- Comfortable with Salesforce
- Previous experience managing a team as well as agencies and/or freelancers

Compensation
This role has an annual starting salary range of $125,000 - $140,000 + equity + benefits.¬†Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to your individual skills and experience.

Who We Are
Settle is a FinTech company on a mission to help businesses thrive by taking the worry out of cash flow management. We‚Äôre building software making it super easy for finance teams to track, pay, and reconcile invoices. We pair that with lending products to offer our customers the power and flexibility to choose who, when, and how to pay their customers.

Our small but growing team was founded in San Francisco along with an engineering hub in Lviv, Ukraine. We‚Äôre building a fully distributed team and support you working from wherever you are. We're well funded (Series-B) with backing by Ribbit, Stripes, Kleiner Perkins, Founder‚Äôs Fund, SciFi Ventures, and others. Our benefits are competitive, our time off is flexible, and our compensation packages include equity.

Check out this Techcrunch article and Kleiner blog post.

Our Commitment to You
At Settle we know that cultivating diversity and fostering an inclusive work environment is critical to our impact and success. We create an environment where no individual is advantaged or disadvantaged because of their background. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

With a commitment to maintaining a bias-free environment in which harassment is prohibited, we respect cultural diversity and comply with the laws of the places in which we operate. We expect our business partners, suppliers, clients, and all of our team members to uphold these commitments.

results.title: (Senior) Growth Marketing Manager (F/M/D)

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

WHY REMBERG

The rembears are a colorful, ambitious, value-driven bunch of problem-solving champions, software-engineering masters, sales machines, customer darlings, design fanatics, product visionaries, sporting aces, beer pong kings & queens and more. In short: you should get to know us.

  • Decide if you want Urban Sports Club membership, JobRad, GuudCard, or financial support with your mobility costs, take care of your mental health with a free nilo.health-subscription and save efficiently for your retirement with our corporate pension plan (bAV)

ABOUT US

remberg is a fast-growing start-up from Munich, building the XRM software, a new kind of solution for companies to digitize processes around 'things', such as equipment, machines, plants, and vehicles - the groundwork for the age of the Internet of Things (IoT).
